schemaMeta.comments: This is where we'll describe the Strategus results data model.

column.name: cdm_source_name
column.comments: The name of the CDM instance.

column.name: cdm_source_abbreviation
column.comments: The abbreviation of the CDM instance.

column.name: cdm_holder
column.comments: The holder of the CDM instance.

column.name: source_description
column.comments: The description of the CDM instance.

column.name: cdm_etl_reference
column.comments: Put the link to the CDM version used.

column.name: source_release_date
column.comments: The release date of the source data.

column.name: cdm_release_date
column.comments: The release data of the CDM instance.

column.name: cdm_version_concept_id
column.comments: The Concept Id representing the version of the CDM.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database identifier

column.name: target_cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The cohort definition id for the target cohort

column.name: outcome_cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The cohort definition id for the outcome cohort

column.name: outcome_type
column.comments: Is the outvome a first occurrence or repeat

column.name: target_outcome_type
column.comments: When does the outcome occur relative to target

column.name: time_to_event
column.comments: The time (in days) from target index to outcome start

column.name: num_events
column.comments: Number of events that occur during the specified time to event

column.name: time_scale
column.comments: time scale for the number of events

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database identifier

column.name: dechallenge_stop_interval
column.comments: The time period that É

column.name: dechallenge_evaluation_window
column.comments: The time period that É

column.name: target_cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The cohort definition id for the target cohort

column.name: outcome_cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The cohort definition id for the outcome cohort

column.name: person_key
column.comments: The dense rank for the patient (an identifier that is not the same as the database)

column.name: subject_id
column.comments: The person identifier for the failed case series (optional)

column.name: dechallenge_exposure_number
column.comments: The number of times a dechallenge has occurred

column.name: dechallenge_exposure_start_date_offset
column.comments: The offset for the dechallenge start (number of days after index)

column.name: dechallenge_exposure_end_date_offset
column.comments: The offset for the dechallenge end (number of days after index)

column.name: dechallenge_outcome_number
column.comments: The number of times an outcome has occurred during the dechallenge

column.name: dechallenge_outcome_start_date_offset
column.comments: The offset for the outcome start (number of days after index)

column.name: rechallenge_exposure_number
column.comments: The number of times a rechallenge exposure has occurred

column.name: rechallenge_exposure_start_date_offset
column.comments: The offset for the rechallenge start (number of days after index)

column.name: rechallenge_exposure_end_date_offset
column.comments: The offset for the rechallenge end (number of days after index)

column.name: rechallenge_outcome_number
column.comments: The number of times the outcome has occurred during the rechallenge

column.name: rechallenge_outcome_start_date_offset
column.comments: The offset for the outcome start (number of days after index)

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database identifier

column.name: dechallenge_stop_interval
column.comments: The dechallenge stop interval

column.name: dechallenge_evaluation_window
column.comments: The dechallenge evaluation window

column.name: target_cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The cohort definition id for the target cohort

column.name: outcome_cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The cohort definition id for the outcome cohort

column.name: num_exposure_eras
column.comments: The number of exposure eras

column.name: num_persons_exposed
column.comments: The number of persons exposed

column.name: num_cases
column.comments: The number of cases

column.name: dechallenge_attempt
column.comments: The number of dechallenge attempts

column.name: dechallenge_fail
column.comments: The dechallenge fail count

column.name: dechallenge_success
column.comments: The dechallenge success count

column.name: rechallenge_attempt
column.comments: The rechallenge attempt count

column.name: rechallenge_fail
column.comments: The rechallenge fail count

column.name: rechallenge_success
column.comments: The rechallenge success count

column.name: pct_dechallenge_attempt
column.comments: The percentage of dechallenge attempts

column.name: pct_dechallenge_success
column.comments: The percentage of dechallenge success

column.name: pct_dechallenge_fail
column.comments: The percentage of dechallenge fails

column.name: pct_rechallenge_attempt
column.comments: The percentage of rechallenge attempts

column.name: pct_rechallenge_success
column.comments: The percentage of rechallenge success

column.name: pct_rechallenge_fail
column.comments: The percentage of rechallenge fails

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database identifier

column.name: setting_id
column.comments: The run identifier

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: The analysis identifier

column.name: analysis_name
column.comments: The analysis name

column.name: domain_id
column.comments: The domain id

column.name: start_day
column.comments: The start day

column.name: end_day
column.comments: The end day

column.name: is_binary
column.comments: Is this a binary analysis

column.name: missing_means_zero
column.comments: Missing means zero

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database identifier

column.name: setting_id
column.comments: The run identifier

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: The covariate identifier

column.name: covariate_name
column.comments: The covariate name

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: The analysis identifier

column.name: concept_id
column.comments: The concept identifier

column.name: value_as_concept_id
column.comments: The value as concept_id for features created from observation or measurement values

column.name: collisions
column.comments: The number of collisions found for the covariate_id

column.comments: The database identifier

column.comments: The run identifier

column.name: min_characterization_mean
column.comments: Minimum fraction for feature extraction

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: The covaraite id

column.name: sum_value
column.comments: The sum value

column.name: average_value
column.comments: The average value

column.comments: The run identifier

column.name: outcome_cohort_id

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: The covariate identifier

column.name: count_value
column.comments: The count value

column.name: min_value
column.comments: The min value

column.name: max_value
column.comments: The max value

column.name: average_value
column.comments: The average value

column.name: standard_deviation
column.comments: The standard devidation

column.name: median_value
column.comments: The median value

column.name: p_10_value
column.comments: The 10th percentile

column.name: p_25_value

column.name: p_90_value

column.comments: The run identifier

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database identifier

column.name: covariate_setting_json
column.comments: The covariate settings JSON

column.name: case_covariate_setting_json
column.comments: The during covariate settings JSON

column.name: min_prior_observation
column.comments: Minimum time observed before index

column.name: outcome_washout_days
column.comments: Patients with outcome during washout are excluded

column.name: risk_window_start
column.comments: The risk window start

column.name: risk_window_end
column.comments: The risk window end

column.name: start_anchor
column.comments: The start anchor

column.name: end_anchor
column.comments: The end anchor

column.name: case_pre_target_duration
column.comments: How far to look back before index for case features

column.name: case_post_outcome_duration
column.comments: How far to look forward after outcome for case features

column.comments: The database identifier

column.comments: The run identifier

column.name: outcome_cohort_id

column.name: risk_window_start
column.comments: The risk window start

column.name: risk_window_end
column.comments: The risk window end

column.name: start_anchor
column.comments: The start anchor

column.name: end_anchor
column.comments: The end anchor

column.name: min_prior_observation
column.comments: Minimum time observed before index

column.name: outcome_washout_days
column.comments: Patients with outcome during washout are excluded

column.name: row_count
column.comments: The number of rows in each cohort

column.name: person_count
column.comments: The number of distinct people in each cohort

column.name: min_exposure_time
column.comments: Minimum exposure time across cohort

column.name: mean_exposure_time
column.comments: Mean exposure time across cohort

column.name: max_exposure_time
column.comments: Max exposure time across cohort

column.name: cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The unique identifier for the cohort definition

column.name: cohort_name
column.comments: The name of the cohort definition

column.name: description
column.comments: A description of the cohort definition

column.name: json
column.comments: The circe-be compiliant JSON expression

column.name: sql_command
column.comments: The OHDSI-SQL command used to construct the cohort

column.name: subset_parent
column.comments: The parent cohort id if this cohort is a subset

column.name: is_subset
column.comments: This value is 1 when the cohort is a subset

column.name: subset_definition_id
column.comments: The cohort subset definition

column.name: cohort_id
column.comments: The uniqe identifier for the cohort definition

column.name: cohort_name
column.comments: The name of the cohort generated

column.name: generation_status
column.comments: The cohort generation status

column.name: start_time
column.comments: The start time of the generation process

column.name: end_time
column.comments: The end time of the generation process

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database idenifier for this information

column.name: cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The unique identifier for the cohort definition

column.name: rule_sequence
column.comments: The rule sequence for the inclusion rule

column.name: name
column.comments: The name of the inclusion rule

column.name: description
column.comments: The description of the inclusion rule

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database idenifier for this information

column.name: cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The unique identifier for the cohort definition

column.name: inclusion_rule_mask
column.comments: A bit-mask for the inclusion rule

column.name: person_count
column.comments: The number of persons satisifying the inclusion rule

column.name: mode_id
column.comments: The mode of the inclusion rule.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database idenifier for this information

column.name: cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The unique identifier for the cohort definition

column.name: rule_sequence
column.comments: The rule sequence

column.name: person_count
column.comments: The person count

column.name: gain_count
column.comments: The gain count

column.name: person_total
column.comments: The person total

column.name: mode_id
column.comments: The mode id

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database idenifier for this information

column.name: cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The unique identifier for the cohort definition

column.name: base_count
column.comments: The base count

column.name: final_count
column.comments: The final count

column.name: mode_id
column.comments: The mode id

column.name: cohort_definition_id
column.comments: The unique identifier for the cohort definition

column.name: lost_count
column.comments: The number lost due to censoring

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database idenifier for this information

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database idenifier for this information

column.name: cohort_id
column.comments: The unique identifier for the cohort definition

column.name: cohort_entries
column.comments: The number of cohort entries

column.name: cohort_subjects
column.comments: The number of unique subjects

column.name: database_id
column.comments: The database idenifier for this information

column.name: cohort_id
column.comments: The unique identifier for the cohort definition

column.name: cohort_entries
column.comments: The number of cohort entries

column.name: cohort_subjects
column.comments: The number of unique subjects

column.name: subset_definition_id
column.comments: The identifier for the cohort subset definition

column.name: json
column.comments: The JSON representation of the subset definition

column.name: cohort_id
column.comments: The cohort identifier for the negative control outcome

column.name: outcome_concept_id
column.comments: The concept ID for the negative control outcome

column.name: cohort_name
column.comments: The concept name for the negative control outcome

column.name: occurrence_type
column.comments: The occurrenceType will detect either: the first time an outcomeConceptId occurs or all times the outcome_concept_id occurs for a person. Values accepted: 'all' or 'first'

column.name: detect_on_descendants
column.comments: When set to 1 detect_on_descendants used the vocabulary to find negative control outcomes using the outcome_concept_id and all descendants via the concept_ancestor table. When set to 0 only the exact outcome_concept_id was used to detect the outcome

column.name: sequence_number
column.comments: The place in the sequence of steps defining the final analysis cohort. 1 indicates the original exposed population without any inclusion criteria.

column.name: description
column.comments: A description of the last restriction, e.g. "Removing persons with the outcome prior".

column.name: subjects
column.comments: The number of subjects in the cohort.

column.name: exposure_id
column.comments: The identifier of the exposure cohort to which the attrition applies. Can be either the target or comparator cohort ID.

column.name: target_id
column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id
column.comments: The identifier for the comparator cohort.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: The identifier for the outcome cohort.

column.name: outcome_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: target_id
column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id
column.comments: The identifier for the comparator cohort.

column.name: outcome_id
column.comments: The identifier for the outcome cohort.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: target_min_days
column.comments: The minimum number of observation days for a person.

column.name: target_p_10_days
column.comments: The 10^th^ percentile of number of observation days for a person in the target group.

column.name: target_p_25_days
column.comments: The 25^th^ percentile of number of observation days for a person in the target group.

column.name: target_median_days
column.comments: The median number of observation days for a person in the target group.

column.name: target_p_75_days
column.comments: The 75^th^ percentile of number of observation days for a person in the target group.

column.name: target_p_90_days
column.comments: The 90^th^ percentile of number of observation days for a person in the target group.

column.name: target_max_days
column.comments: The maximum number of observation days for a person in the target group.

column.name: comparator_min_days
column.comments: The minimum number of observation days for a person in the comparator group.

column.name: comparator_p_10_days
column.comments: The 10^th^ percentile of number of observation days for a person in the comparator group.

column.name: comparator_p_25_days
column.comments: The 25^th^ percentile of number of observation days for a person in the comparator group.

column.name: comparator_median_days
column.comments: The median number of observation days for a person in the comparator group.

column.name: comparator_p_75_days
column.comments: The 75^th^ percentile of number of observation days for a person in the comparator group.

column.name: comparator_p_90_days
column.comments: The 90^th^ percentile of number of observation days for a person in the comparator group.

column.name: comparator_max_days
column.comments: The maximum number of observation days for a person in the comparator group.

column.name: target_min_date
column.comments: The first start date of the target cohort observed in the data (after applying all restrictions).

column.name: target_max_date
column.comments: The last start date of the target cohort observed in the data (after applying all restrictions).

column.name: comparator_min_date
column.comments: The first start date of the comparator cohort observed in the data (after applying all restrictions).

column.name: comparator_max_date
column.comments: The last start date of the comparator cohort observed in the data (after applying all restrictions).

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A unique identifier for an analysis.

column.name: description
column.comments: A description for an analysis, e.g. 'On-treatment'.

column.name: definition
column.comments: A CohortMethod JSON object specifying the analysis.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: target_id
column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id
column.comments: The identifier for the comparator cohort.

column.name: outcome_id
column.comments: The identifier for the outcome cohort.

column.name: rr
column.comments: The estimated relative risk (e.g. the hazard ratio).

column.name: ci_95_lb
column.comments: The lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: ci_95_ub
column.comments: The upper bound of the 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: p
column.comments: The two-sided p-value considering the null hypothesis of no effect.

column.name: one_sided_p
column.comments: The one-sided p-value considering the null hypothesis of RR <= 1.

column.name: target_subjects
column.comments: The number of subject in the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_subjects
column.comments: The number of subject in the comparator cohort.

column.name: target_days
column.comments: The number of days observed in the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_days
column.comments: The number of days observed in the comparator cohort.

column.name: target_outcomes
column.comments: The number of outcomes observed in the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_outcomes
column.comments: The number of outcomes observed in the comparator cohort.

column.name: log_rr
column.comments: The log of the relative risk.

column.name: se_log_rr
column.comments: The standard error of the log of the relative risk.

column.name: llr
column.comments: The log of the likelihood ratio (of the MLE vs the null hypothesis of no effect).

column.name: calibrated_rr
column.comments: The calibrated relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_ci_95_lb
column.comments: The lower bound of the calibrated 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_ci_95_ub
column.comments: The upper bound of the calibrated 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_p
column.comments: The calibrated two-sided p-value.

column.name: calibrated_one_sided_p
column.comments: The calibrated one-sided p-value considering the null hypothesis of RR <= 1.

column.name: calibrated_log_rr
column.comments: The log of the calibrated relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_se_log_rr
column.comments: The standard error of the log of the calibrated relative risk.

column.name: target_estimator
column.comments: The target estimator, for example "att", "ate", "atu" or "ato".

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: target_id
column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id
column.comments: The identifier for the comparator cohort.

column.name: outcome_id
column.comments: The identifier for the outcome cohort.

column.name: interaction_covariate_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the cm_covariate table.

column.name: rr
column.comments: The estimated relative risk (e.g. the ratio of hazard ratios).

column.name: ci_95_lb
column.comments: The lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: ci_95_ub
column.comments: The upper bound of the 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: p
column.comments: The two-sided p-value considering the null hypothesis of no interaction effect.

column.name: target_subjects
column.comments: The number of subject in the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_subjects
column.comments: The number of subject in the comparator cohort.

column.name: target_days
column.comments: The number of days observed in the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_days
column.comments: The number of days observed in the comparator cohort.

column.name: target_outcomes
column.comments: The number of outcomes observed in the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_outcomes
column.comments: The number of outcomes observed in the comparator cohort.

column.name: log_rr
column.comments: The log of the relative risk.

column.name: se_log_rr
column.comments: The standard error of the log of the relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_rr
column.comments: The calibrated relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_ci_95_lb
column.comments: The lower bound of the calibrated 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_ci_95_ub
column.comments: The upper bound of the calibrated 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_p
column.comments: The calibrated two-sided p-value.

column.name: calibrated_log_rr
column.comments: The log of the calibrated relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_se_log_rr
column.comments: The standard error of the log of the calibrated relative risk.

column.name: target_estimator
column.comments: The target estimator, for example "att", "ate", "atu" or "ato".

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: A unique identified for a covariate.

column.name: covariate_name
column.comments: A name for a covariate, e.g. 'Age group: 20-25 years'.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: covariate_analysis_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the cm_covariate_analysis table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: covariate_analysis_id
column.comments: A unique identifier for a covariate analysis (only guaranteed to be unique for a given analysis_id and database_id).

column.name: covariate_analysis_name
column.comments: A name for a covariate analysis, e.g. 'Demographics: age group'.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: target_id
column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id
column.comments: The identifier for the comparator cohort.

column.name: outcome_id
column.comments: The identifier for the outcome cohort.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the cm_covariate table.

column.name: target_mean_before
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the target cohort before propensity score adjustment.

column.name: comparator_mean_before
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the comparator cohort before propensity score adjustment.

column.name: mean_before
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the union of the target and comparator cohort before propensity score adjustment.

column.name: std_diff_before
column.comments: The standardized difference of the means between the target and comparator cohort before propensity score adjustment.

column.name: mean_after
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the union of the target and comparator cohort after propensity score adjustment.

column.name: target_mean_after
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the target cohort after propensity score adjustment.

column.name: comparator_mean_after
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the comparator cohort after propensity score adjustment.

column.name: std_diff_after
column.comments: The standardized difference of the means between the target and comparator cohort after propensity score adjustment.

column.name: target_std_diff
column.comments: The standardized difference of the means before and after propensity score adjustment in the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_std_diff
column.comments: The standardized difference of the means before and after propensity score adjustment in the comparator cohort.

column.name: target_comparator_std_diff
column.comments: The standardized difference of the means before and after propensity score adjustment in the union of the target and comparator cohorts.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: target_id
column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id
column.comments: The identifier for the comparator cohort.

column.name: outcome_id
column.comments: The identifier for the outcome cohort.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: max_sdm
column.comments: The maximum absolute standardized difference of mean.

column.name: shared_max_sdm
column.comments: The maximum absolute standardized difference of mean of the shared balance (shared across outcomes).

column.name: equipoise
column.comments: The fraction of the study population with a preference score between 0.3 and 0.7.

column.name: mdrr
column.comments: The minimum detectable relative risk.

column.name: attrition_fraction
column.comments: DEPRECATED: The fraction of the target population lost by between initial cohort and outcome model due to various restrictions.

column.name: generalizability_max_sdm
column.comments: The maximum absolute standardized difference of mean comparing before to after adjustment.

column.name: ease
column.comments: The expected absolute systematic error.

column.name: balance_diagnostic
column.comments: Pass / warning / fail classification of the balance diagnostic (max_sdm).

column.name: shared_balance_diagnostic
column.comments: Pass / warning / fail classification of the shared balance diagnostic (shared_max_sdm).

column.name: equipoise_diagnostic
column.comments: Pass / warning / fail classification of the equipoise diagnostic.

column.name: mdrr_diagnostic
column.comments: Pass / warning / fail classification of the MDRR diagnostic.

column.name: attrition_diagnostic
column.comments: DEPRECATED: Pass / warning / fail classification of the attrition fraction diagnostic.

column.name: generalizability_diagnostic
column.comments: Pass / warning / fail classification of the generalizability diagnostic.

column.name: ease_diagnostic
column.comments: Pass / warning / fail classification of the EASE diagnostic.

column.name: unblind
column.comments: Is unblinding the result recommended? (1 = yes, 0 = no)

column.name: unblind_for_evidence_synthesis
column.comments: Is unblinding the result for inclusion in evidence synthesis recommended? This ignores the MDRR diagnostic. (1 = yes, 0 = no)

column.name: outcome_id
column.comments: The identifier for the outcome cohort.

column.name: outcome_of_interest
column.comments: Is the outcome of interest (1 = yes, 0 = no)

column.name: true_effect_size
column.comments: The true effect size for the target-comparator-outcome. For negatitive controls this equals 1.

column.name: target_id
column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id
column.comments: The identifier for the comparator cohort.

column.name: time_day
column.comments: Time in days since cohort start.

column.name: target_survival
column.comments: The estimated survival fraction in the target cohort.

column.name: target_survival_lb
column.comments: The lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the survival fraction in the target cohort.

column.name: target_survival_ub
column.comments: The upper bound of the 95% confidence interval of the survival fraction in the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_survival
column.comments: The estimated survival fraction in the comparator cohort.

column.name: comparator_survival_lb
column.comments: The lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the survival fraction in the comparator cohort.

column.name: comparator_survival_ub
column.comments: The upper bound of the 95% confidence interval of the survival fraction in the comparator cohort.

column.name: target_at_risk
column.comments: The number of subjects still at risk in the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_at_risk
column.comments: The number of subjects still at risk in the comparator cohort.

column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id
column.comments: The identifier for the comparator cohort.

column.comments: The identifier for the outcome cohort.

column.comments: A foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: log_rr
column.comments: The log of the relative risk where the likelihood is sampled.

column.name: log_likelihood
column.comments: The normalized log likelihood.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: preference_score
column.comments: A preference score value.

column.name: target_density
column.comments: The distribution density for the target cohort at the given preference score.

column.name: comparator_density
column.comments: The distribution density for the comparator cohort at the given preference score.

column.name: target_id
column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id
column.comments: The identifier for the comparator cohort.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the cm_covariate table. 0 is reserved for the intercept.

column.name: coefficient
column.comments: The coefficient (beta) for the covariate in the propensity model.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: target_id
column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id
column.comments: The identifier for the comparator cohort.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the cm_analysis table.

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the cm_covariate table.

column.name: mean_before
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the union of the target and comparator cohort before propensity score adjustment.

column.name: target_mean_before
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the target cohort before propensity score adjustment.

column.name: comparator_mean_before
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the comparator cohort before propensity score adjustment.

column.name: std_diff_before
column.comments: The standardized difference of the means between the target and comparator cohort before propensity score adjustment.

column.name: mean_after
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the union of the target and comparator cohort after propensity score adjustment.

column.name: target_mean_after
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the target cohort after propensity score adjustment.

column.name: comparator_mean_after
column.comments: The mean value of the covariate in the comparator cohort after propensity score adjustment.

column.name: std_diff_after
column.comments: The standardized difference of the means between the target and comparator cohort after propensity score adjustment.

column.name: target_std_diff
column.comments: The standardized difference of the means before and after propensity score adjustment in the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_std_diff
column.comments: The standardized difference of the means before and after propensity score adjustment in the comparator cohort.

column.name: target_comparator_std_diff
column.comments: The standardized difference of the means before and after propensity score adjustment in the union of the target and comparator cohorts.

column.name: evidence_synthesis_analysis_id
column.comments: A unique identifier for the evidence synthesis analysis.

column.name: evidence_synthesis_description
column.comments: A description of the evidence synthesis analysis.

column.name: source_method
column.comments: The method used to produce the source estimates (e.g. 'CohortMethod').

column.name: definition
column.comments: A JSON string representing the settings of the evidence synthesis analysis.

column.name: target_id
column.comments: The identifier for the target cohort.

column.name: comparator_id

column.name: outcome_id

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A unique identifier for the cohort method analysis.

column.name: evidence_synthesis_analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the es_analysis table.

column.name: mdrr
column.comments: The minimum detectable relative risk.

column.name: i_2
column.comments: The I2 statistics for heterogeneity.

column.name: tau
column.comments: The estimated tau (standard deviation of the random-effects distribution).

column.name: ease
column.comments: The expected absolute systematic error.

column.name: mdrr_diagnostic
column.comments: PASS/ NOT EVALUATED / FAIL classification of the MDRR diagnostic.

column.name: i_2_diagnostic
column.comments: PASS/ NOT EVALUATED / FAIL classification of the I2 diagnostic.

column.name: tau_diagnostic
column.comments: PPASS/ NOT EVALUATED / FAIL classification of the tau diagnostic.

column.name: ease_diagnostic
column.comments: PASS/ NOT EVALUATED / FAIL classification of the EASE diagnostic.

column.name: unblind
column.comments: Is unblinding the result recommended? (1 = yes, 0 = no)

column.name: rr
column.comments: The estimated relative risk (e.g. the hazard ratio).

column.name: ci_95_lb
column.comments: The lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: ci_95_ub
column.comments: The upper bound of the 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: p
column.comments: The two-sided p-value considering the null hypothesis of no effect.

column.name: one_sided_p
column.comments: The one-sided p-value considering the null hypothesis of RR <= 1.

column.name: log_rr
column.comments: The log of the relative risk.

column.name: se_log_rr
column.comments: The standard error of the log of the relative risk.

column.name: target_outcomes

column.name: comparator_outcomes

column.name: n_databases
column.comments: The number of databases that contributed to the meta-analytic estimate.

column.name: calibrated_rr

column.name: calibrated_ci_95_lb

column.name: calibrated_ci_95_ub

column.name: calibrated_p

column.name: calibrated_one_sided_p
column.comments: The calibrated one-sided p-value considering the null hypothesis of RR <= 1.

column.name: calibrated_log_rr
column.comments: The log of the calibrated relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_se_log_rr
column.comments: The standard error of the log of the calibrated relative risk.

column.name: person_count_at_risk
column.comments: The number of target patients with the age/gender of interest

column.name: person_count_with_outcome
column.comments: The number of target patients with the age/gender of interest who also have the outcome during TAR

column.name: average_predicted_probability
column.comments: the mean predicted risk

column.name: st_dev_predicted_probability
column.comments: the standard deviation of the predicted risk

column.name: min_predicted_probability
column.comments: the min predicted risk

column.name: p_25_predicted_probability
column.comments: the 25% quantile of predicted risk

column.name: p_50_predicted_probability
column.comments: The median predicted risk

column.name: p_75_predicted_probability
column.comments: the 75% quantile of predicted risk

column.name: max_predicted_probability
column.comments: the max predicted risk

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A unique identifier for an analysis.

column.name: description
column.comments: A description for an analysis, e.g. 'Correcting for age and season'.

column.name: definition
column.comments: A JSON object specifying the analysis.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: covariate_analysis_id
column.comments: A unique identifier for a covariate analysis.

column.name: covariate_analysis_name
column.comments: A name for a covariate analysis, e.g. 'Pre-exposure'.

column.name: variable_of_interest
column.comments: Is the variable of interest (1 = yes, 0 = no).

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: A unique identifier for a covariate.

column.name: covariate_name
column.comments: A description for the covariate.

column.name: era_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_era table.

column.name: covariate_analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_covariate_analysis table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A unique identifier for an analysis.

column.name: era_type
column.comments: The type of era (e.g. 'rx' for drugs).

column.name: era_id
column.comments: A unique identifier, corresponding to the ID in the source table (e.g. cohort_definition_id in a cohort table, or the drug_concept_id in the drug_era table).

column.name: era_name
column.comments: A name for the era. Is NULL for eras derived from cohorts.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A unique identifier for a set of exposures and an outcome.

column.name: outcome_id
column.comments: A cohort ID.

column.name: nesting_cohort_id
column.comments: A cohort ID.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: era_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_era table.

column.name: true_effect_size
column.comments: If known, the true effect size. For negatitive controls this equals 1.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: spline_type
column.comments: Either 'age', 'season', or 'calendar time'.

column.name: knot_month
column.comments: Location of the knot. For age, the month since birth. For season, the month of the year. For calendar time, the month since 1-1-1970.

column.name: rr
column.comments: The estimated relative risk (i.e. the incidence rate ratio).

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: parameter_id
column.comments: The parameter number in the censor model (starting at 1).

column.name: parameter_value
column.comments: The fitted parameter value.

column.name: model_type
column.comments: The type of censor model. Can be 'Weibull-Age'. 'Weibull-Interval', 'Gamma-Age', or 'Gamma-Interval'.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_covariate table. The identifier for the covariate of interest.

column.name: rr
column.comments: The estimated relative risk (i.e. the incidence rate ratio).

column.name: ci_95_lb
column.comments: The lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: ci_95_ub
column.comments: The upper bound of the 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: p
column.comments: The two-sided p-value considering the null hypothesis of no effect.

column.name: one_sided_p
column.comments: The one-sided p-value considering the null hypothesis of IRR <= 1.

column.name: outcome_subjects
column.comments: The number of subjects with at least one outcome.

column.name: outcome_events
column.comments: The number of outcome events.

column.name: outcome_observation_periods
column.comments: The number of observation periods containing at least one outcome.

column.name: covariate_subjects
column.comments: The number of subjects having the covariate.

column.name: covariate_days
column.comments: The total covariate time in days.

column.name: covariate_eras
column.comments: The number of continuous eras of the covariate.

column.name: covariate_outcomes
column.comments: The number of outcomes observed during the covariate time.

column.name: observed_days
column.comments: The number of days subjects were observed.

column.name: log_rr
column.comments: The log of the relative risk.

column.name: se_log_rr
column.comments: The standard error of the log of the relative risk.

column.name: llr
column.comments: The log of the likelihood ratio (of the MLE vs the null hypothesis of no effect).

column.name: calibrated_rr
column.comments: The calibrated relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_ci_95_lb
column.comments: The lower bound of the calibrated 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_ci_95_ub
column.comments: The upper bound of the calibrated 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_p
column.comments: The calibrated two-sided p-value.

column.name: calibrated_one_sided_p
column.comments: The calibrated one-sided p-value considering the null hypothesis of IRR <= 1.

column.name: calibrated_log_rr
column.comments: The log of the calibrated relative risk.

column.name: calibrated_se_log_rr
column.comments: The standard error of the log of the calibrated relative risk.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: The identifier for the covariate.

column.name: rr
column.comments: The estimated relative risk (i.e. the incidence rate ratio).

column.name: ci_95_lb
column.comments: The lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: ci_95_ub
column.comments: The upper bound of the 95% confidence interval of the relative risk.

column.name: sequence_number
column.comments: The place in the sequence of steps defining the final analysis cohort. 1 indicates the original exposed population without any inclusion criteria.

column.name: description
column.comments: A description of the last restriction, e.g. "Removing persons with the outcome prior".

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_covariate table. The identifier for the covariate of interest.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: outcome_subjects
column.comments: The number of subjects with at least one outcome.

column.name: outcome_events
column.comments: The number of outcome events.

column.name: outcome_observation_periods
column.comments: The number of observation periods containing at least one outcome.

column.name: observed_days
column.comments: The number of days subjects were observed.

column.name: log_rr
column.comments: The log of the relative risk where the likelihood is sampled.

column.name: log_likelihood
column.comments: The normalized log likelihood.

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: The identifier for the covariate of interest.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: calendar_year
column.comments: The calendar year (e.g. 2022).

column.name: calendar_month
column.comments: The calendar month (e.g. 1 for January).

column.name: observed_subjects
column.comments: Number of people observed during the month.

column.name: ratio
column.comments: Observed over expected ratio, where the expected count assumes a constant rate over time.

column.name: adjusted_ratio
column.comments: Observed over expected ratio, where the expected count is adjusted for age, season, or calendar time, as specified in the analysis.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: era_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_era table. The identifier for the era of interest.

column.name: week
column.comments: The number of the week relative to exposure. Week 0 starts on the day of exposure initiation.

column.name: observed_subjects
column.comments: The numer of people observed during the week.

column.name: outcomes
column.comments: The number of outcomes observed durig the week.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: age_month
column.comments: Age in months since birth.

column.name: cover_before_after_subjects
column.comments: Number of subjects whose observation period covers this month as well as the one before and after.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: calendar_year
column.comments: Calendar year (e.g. 2022)

column.name: calendar_month
column.comments: Calendar month (e.g. 1 is January).

column.name: cover_before_after_subjects
column.comments: Number of subjects whose observation period covers this month as well as the one before and after.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: months_to_end
column.comments: Number of months until observation end.

column.name: censored
column.comments: Whether the observation is censored (meaning, not equal to the end of database time). (1 = censored, 0 = not censored).

column.name: outcomes
column.comments: Number of outcomes observed during the month.

column.name: analysis_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_analysis table.

column.name: exposures_outcome_set_id
column.comments: A foreign key referencing the sccs_exposures_outcome_set table.

column.name: covariate_id
column.comments: The identifier for the covariate of interest.

column.name: database_id
column.comments: Foreign key referencing the database.

column.name: mdrr
column.comments: The minimum detectable relative risk.

column.name: ease
column.comments: The expected absolute systematic error.

column.name: time_trend_p
column.comments: The p for whether the mean monthly ratio between observed and expected is no greater than 1.25.

column.name: pre_exposure_p
column.comments: One-sided p-value for whether the rate before expore is higher than after, against the null of no difference.

column.name: mdrr_diagnostic
column.comments: Pass / warning / fail / not evaluated classification of the MDRR diagnostic.

column.name: ease_diagnostic
column.comments: Pass / warning / fail / not evaluated classification of the EASE diagnostic.

column.name: time_trend_diagnostic
column.comments: Pass / warning / fail / not evaluated classification of the time trend (unstalbe months) diagnostic.

column.name: pre_exposure_diagnostic
column.comments: Pass / warning / fail / not evaluated classification of the time trend (unstalbe months) diagnostic.

column.name: unblind
column.comments: Is unblinding the result recommended? (1 = yes, 0 = no)

column.name: unblind_for_evidence_synthesis
column.comments: Is unblinding the result for inclusion in evidence synthesis recommended? This ignores the MDRR diagnostic. (1 = yes, 0 = no)
